articles.author: ZEKE MILLER, LEAH ASKARINAM, MAYA SWEEDLER and CHAD DAY
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris has secured the support of enough Democratic delegates to become her party’s nominee against Republican Donald Trump, according to an Associated Press survey, as top Democrats rallied to her in the aftermath of President Joe Biden’s decision to drop his bid for reelection.
articles.title: Harris has support of enough Democratic delegates to become party’s presidential nominee: AP survey

articles.author: CALVIN WOODWARD, MARY CLARE JALONICK, STEPHEN GROVES and ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — As the formulaic “pass the torch” drumbeat thumped on from lawmakers wanting him to quit the race, President Joe Biden maintained a brave face.
articles.title: Biden passed that torch slowly, hanging on until the wheels finally came off

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: REHOBOTH BEACH, Del. (AP) — President Joe Biden says he's “determined to get as much done" as he possibly can in his final six months in the White House as he tries to beat back a defining force that his lame-duck predecessors struggled to vanquish: diminished relevance.
articles.title: Biden aims for more achievements despite the bane of lame-duck presidents: diminished relevance

articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER, ASHRAF KHALIL and FARNOUSH AMIRI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's visit to Washington this week is looming as a fraught one between the two allies, coming at a moment of extreme political flux in the United States, and wariness among American leaders about Netanyahu's history of interjecting himself into U.S.
articles.title: Netanyahu is in Washington at a fraught time for Israel and the US. What to know about his visit

articles.author: MELANIE LIDMAN
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The Israeli government has budgeted millions of dollars to protect small, unauthorized Jewish farms in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, underwriting tiny outposts meant to grow into full-fledged settlements, according to an anti-settlement monitoring group.
articles.title: Israeli government quietly sends millions to unauthorized West Bank settler outposts

articles.author: ALANNA DURKIN RICHER, FARNOUSH AMIRI and CLAUDIA LAUER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle said Monday that her agency failed in its mission to protect former President Donald Trump, as lawmakers of both major political parties demanded during a highly contentious congressional hearing that she resign over security failures that allowed a gunman to scale a roof and open fire at a campaign rally.
articles.title: Secret Service director, grilled by lawmakers on the Trump assassination attempt, says 'we failed'

articles.author: JOHN O'CONNOR
articles.description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (AP) — Sonya Massey ducked and apologized to an Illinois sheriff’s deputy seconds before he shot the Black woman three times in her home, with one fatal blow to the head, as seen in body camera video released Monday.
articles.title: Bodycam video reveals chaotic scene of deputy fatally shooting Sonya Massey, who called 911 for help

articles.author: JOSHUA GOODMAN and REGINA GARCIA CANO
articles.description: AGUA CALIENTE, Venezuela (AP) — At a crossroads not far from a gas station overgrown with weeds, young men and women in faded green fatigues stop vehicles returning from a rally for opponents of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, ask passengers for their identifications, and inspect their cars, trucks and motorcycles.
articles.title: Maduro seeks to shore up Venezuela military's support ahead of vote threatening his hold on power

articles.author: RENATA BRITO
articles.description: BARCELONA, Spain (AP) — The children sometimes won't stop crying. Health workers dealing with migrants arriving on Spain's Canary Islands try to understand if the tears are from illness, injury or, as is often the case, from pure shock.
articles.title: Thousands of migrant kids have reached the Canary Islands alone. Local officials want Spain's help

articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — U.S. House leaders are calling on CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz to testify to Congress about the cybersecurity company's role in sparking the widespread tech outage that grounded flights, knocked banks and hospital systems offline and affected services around the world.
articles.title: CrowdStrike CEO called to testify to Congress over cybersecurity's firm role in global tech outage
